Paul Stirling is over the moon with the result, hoping to carry the momentum into the ODIs.
Ross Adair expressed his satisfaction with his century and the win, stating that he wanted to put his mark and get a good score.
Paul Stirling acknowledged that spending time at the crease was crucial to understanding the pace of the wicket, which ultimately won them the game.
Paul Stirling, the winning captain, expressed that the team felt they were 15-20 runs short at the halfway mark but managed to pull through and secure the win.
Aiden Markram, the captain of South Africa, mentioned that there were small moments with both bat and ball that they missed on and that losing wickets at the death did not help their cause.
